intro: Calycothrix puberula, commonly known as the hairy calycothrix, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, soft appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Calycothrix puberula is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
